name: Flanders Hotel

reviews.text: Friendly staff,central location, variety at breakfast.
reviews.title: Spacious Rooms

reviews.text: Loved everything!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with a great Happy Hour Bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with two friends in a triple room at this hotel for 2 nights and loved. Clean, excellent facilities, great breakfast and helpful staff. Nice area of the town with lots of little bars and restaurants but away from the truly too busy spots. For us though the best element was the hotel bar which had a great happy hour from 4 to 6. It was a great chance to try loads of the different types of beers at 50% of their normal price which was a great way to start our evening.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location was perfect, quick walk to the center but not too close to be overwhelmed by busloads of tourists. Room could use some updating but was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very nice and the bar was very enjoyable for a drink before dinner. Was disapointed to see that the local restaurants really take advantage of the tourism with very high prices for mediocre food and poor service. Still a lovely city and enjoyed the Sunday street fair.
reviews.title: great hotel, in cracker city

reviews.text: the hotel for us [two couples] was great value, we stayed in both the deluxe suite and the ordinary suite, though we were supposed to have two deluxe, but both rooms were fine, and even though the weather was very warm it was no problem without AC, the breakfast is first class, also made us breakfast for 5am on day of departure, and arranged taxi to station,bar has a half price deal from 4 to 6,and the location great for all the sites, staff were very good, and overall would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel ,and wonderful city
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Hotel in a Beautiful City

reviews.text: The lobby and bar areas at the entrance of the hotel were modern and functional with a small elevator close by. Our room was quite spartan - somewhat of the "good news / bad news" cliche. Clean and functional - a place to sleep at the end of a day or walking the streets of Bruges, but certainly not something that invited you to feel comfy and relaxed. The location was not the best either. As we walked through the city square and surrounding streets we found that it would have been much more convenient to be nearer the center of town than out on the periphery at Flanders. Overall the hotel was nothing to write home about and oddly seemed much more like a business no frills hotel set in a city where people come for pleasure - not business. Go figure.
reviews.title: Rooms are very spartan

reviews.text: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great location & excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellent from the moment we checked in. The lady on reception was very friendly, her English was very good as was most of the people in the hotel. She gave us a map & explained where a few of the highlights were in Bruges & how to get there.
reviews.title: 2nd visit as good as the first....

reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: €14 for this.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Booked using Booking.com which is excellent for booking rooms with kids as it tells you which hotels have rooms big enough to accommodate you. We actually booked a triple but there were 4 of us. I emailed the hotel and they made another bed available for no extra cost. €141 incl bfast for the room.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pre-booked a parking place via email at the back of the hotel (€14 euros a night extra until 1pm next day) The room was big and actually had 5 beds in it (room 223) which was very clean and a great family room and not many stairs to climb. Was good to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Kids enjoyed using the little swimming pool.
reviews.title: A good central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a happy hour on 4 – 6pm great value beers but unfortunately for my wife none of the cocktails were reduced. Staff were helpful and gave us a map and recommendations on what to do in Bruges. The hotel is located only a 10 mins stroll from the market square and bell tower. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice on the buffet both hot & cold.
reviews.title: Strongly recommended

reviews.text: Hotel very central and has on site parking costing 14 Euros per 24hrs. Staff friendly. Used pool once, quite small and outsated - needs doing up and only had 1 plastic chair, could do with some more chairs/some loungers in case you just wanted to sit down/accompanying a child/someone etc.
reviews.title: Very good indeed
Ahhhhh, Lovely Brugge and the Flanders Hotel
reviews.text: Room a decent size with excellent bathroom - great deep bath! Large selection of toiletries. Air con was a bit noisy sometimes. Tea/coffee making facilities but no milk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flanders hotel is situated near the center but still on a very quiet location. Our standard room was OK.. it needs some renovation, but it was spacious and very very clean. I reckon that the deluxe rooms and the suites are recently renovated and they are much-much nicer. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was superb! Overall our stay was very pleasant and Bruges is a beautiful town. Renting a bike is a must!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great breakfast, excelent location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here in August 2011 and I loved the hotel. I booked the suit which was beautiful, the only negative about my room was that it was not an air conditioned room but when I mentioned this to the receptionist she immediately arranged for a fan to be delivered to the room. I will definitely stay here on my next visit
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel after booking through an internet late deals site. A very pretty hotel. Our family quadruple room was a really good size and very handy for the pool, but it was very warm and lacked airconditioning or adequate ventilation. It was situated on the ground floor (room 15), with only french doors for ventilation which wasn't ideal at night. I couldn't help but think that as it was a low cost room it probably wasn't up to the decor standard of the rest of the hotel. The rest of the building was beautifully done. We found the staff very helpful and thought Bruges was stunning.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Flanders to celebrate our 25th Wedding Annirversary. On arrival at the hotel we were dismayed to find that there was no booking in our name on the computer. they kept us waiting for half an hour before they found us a room.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was pleasant. The hotel clean and very well managed, with lovely contempory public areas. This was marred by the fact that we had no explanation or appolgy from the hotel management as to why we were not on the system.
reviews.title: lovely rooms and excellent breakfast
